story:
Dear son, here is a bedtime story for you:

Once upon a time, in a small village nestled in the mountains, there was a young boy named Ahir. Ahir was a curious and adventurous soul, with a heart full of wonder and a mind full of questions. He loved to explore the world around him, and to learn about the mysterious forces that shaped it.

As he lay in bed at night, Ahir would often gaze out the window at the stars twinkling above, and wonder about the great unknown. "What lies beyond the reaches of our village?" he would ask himself. "What secrets do the stars hold?"

One night, as Ahir was drifting off to sleep, he heard a gentle knock at his door. It was his father, a wise and kind Buddhist monk named Kaito. Kaito wore a warm and gentle smile on his face, and his eyes shone like the stars in the night sky.

"Ahir, my son," Kaito said, "tonight, I will take you on a journey into the mysteries of the universe. Come, let us walk under the stars."

Together, Ahir and Kaito stepped out into the night air, and began to walk in silence. The stars seemed to grow brighter, and the air was filled with the sweet fragrance of blooming flowers. As they walked, Kaito pointed out the constellations, telling Ahir stories of the ancient gods and goddesses who dwelled among the stars.

As they reached a small clearing, Kaito stopped and looked up at the sky. "Ahir, have you ever noticed that the stars are like the threads of a great tapestry?" he asked. "Each one is connected to every other, woven together in a delicate and complex pattern. And yet, each thread is unique and special, carrying its own story and its own light."

Ahir looked up in amazement, his eyes wide with wonder. "Yes, father," he said, "I see the stars like that. But what about the darkness between them? Is that just nothingness?"

Kaito smiled. "Ah, but the darkness is not nothingness, Ahir. It is the canvas on which the stars shine. It is the silence between the notes of the great cosmic melody. And it is the very foundation of existence itself."

As they walked on, the stars seemed to grow even brighter, and Ahir felt his heart expanding with a sense of connection to all things. He realized that he was a part of this vast tapestry, connected to every star, every flower, every breath of air.

And as they returned to the village, Ahir felt a deep sense of peace settle over him. He knew that he would never forget this journey under the stars, and the wisdom that his father had shared with him.

And so, my dear son, I hope that you too will always remember the magic of the stars, and the infinite wonder of the universe. May you carry their light with you always, and may you find peace and guidance on your own journey through the night.

May you sleep soundly, and may your dreams be filled with the beauty and wonder of the stars.
